clamour.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a very loud noise made by a large group of people or animals
clamour.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He shouted over the rising clamour of voices.
clamour.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the expression of feelings of anger and shock by a large number of people – used especially in news reports
clamour.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Trouillot disregarded the growing public clamour for her resignation.
clamour.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The audience cheered, clamoring for more.
All his friends were clamouring to know where he’d been.
